mdRecord.dcterms:title: Annie Pfeiffer Chapel and William H. Danforth Chapel, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
Wright, Frank Lloyd (American architect, 1867-1959) [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Entrance view of Annie Pfeiffer Chapel and Danforth Chapel

"This building (Annie Pfeiffer Chapel) is generally regarded as Wright's most noted work at FSC. Completed in 1941, it commands center stage on campus reflecting the college's religious affiliation, and the fact that Wright was a Methodist himself." --http://www.franklloydwrightatfsc.com/FSC-FLW%20Doc%20-%20Early%20Years.htm "William H Danforth Chapel... was the second chapel Wright designed for FSC, and is the only use of leaded glass on the campus." --http://www.franklloydwrightatfsc.com/FSC-FLW%20Doc%20-%20Final%20Additions.htm [work]
